column4: Anybody know how to make an nvidia geforce 8600 gs work? When I put it in the machine, the machine just gives me a blank screen upon boot.
you may have to disable the onboard video in the bios first
I think I did that, I'll double check, but you're right that I have onboard video.
is the onboard video the serial Port1 address or the parallel port address? I don't see anything that resembles video aside from those.
its neither. If its a newer mobo it may do it automatically. My suggestion is more an oldschool fix.
darn...any other thoughts then? I can't get the thing to boot if the nvidea card is in the pci slot.
wait...what kind of card is it? agp/pci or pcie?
pcie
I do have a setting called "Init Display First" which can be set to either 'pci' or 'pci express card'. No idea what it means though.
sounds like a hardware prob for sure if its black from the moment you hit the power button
thats what you need to do...
set it to pci express card
I put in that setting, then put in the card, but I still can't get anything to come up on the display.
your not putting the card in with the power on right?
Right-o
that's a correct - I'm powering off before adding/removing any hardware.
does that card require power? newer cards actualy require power from the powersupply, plugged directly onto it
interesting theory...you had me worried for a second, but no, no power needed.
silly question, but you do have the monitor securly plugged in to the card, not the onboard
yep.
tried both though...neither works when the nvidia card is plugged in.
wow, hmm, ive got no idea. you may have to go to another forum, nvidia forums or something. Could be faulty hardware. or a simple bios setting ive long forgotten
Oh well, thanks anyway. Good to have a second opinion.
no prob. good luck!
